00097 void lu_object_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
00098 {
00099         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00100         struct lu_object_header *top;
00101         struct lu_site          *site;
00102         struct lu_object        *orig;
00103         struct cfs_hash_bd            bd;
00104         const struct lu_fid     *fid;
00105 
00106         top  = o->lo_header;
00107         site = o->lo_dev->ld_site;
00108         orig = o;
00109 
00110         /*
00111          * till we have full fids-on-OST implemented anonymous objects
00112          * are possible in OSP. such an object isn't listed in the site
00113          * so we should not remove it from the site.
00114          */
00115         fid = lu_object_fid(o);
00116         if (fid_is_zero(fid)) {
00117                 LASSERT(top->loh_hash.next == NULL
00118                         && top->loh_hash.pprev == NULL);
00119                 LASSERT(list_empty(&top->loh_lru));
00120                 if (!atomic_dec_and_test(&top->loh_ref))
00121                         return;
00122                 list_for_each_entry_reverse(o, &top->loh_layers, lo_linkage) {
00123                         if (o->lo_ops->loo_object_release != NULL)
00124                                 o->lo_ops->loo_object_release(env, o);
00125                 }
00126                 lu_object_free(env, orig);
00127                 return;
00128         }
00129 
00130         cfs_hash_bd_get(site->ls_obj_hash, &top->loh_fid, &bd);
00131         bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd);
00132 
00133         if (!cfs_hash_bd_dec_and_lock(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd, &top->loh_ref)) {
00134                 if (lu_object_is_dying(top)) {
00135 
00136                         /*
00137                          * somebody may be waiting for this, currently only
00138                          * used for cl_object, see cl_object_put_last().
00139                          */
00140                         wake_up_all(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre);
00141                 }
00142                 return;
00143         }
00144 
00145         /*
00146          * When last reference is released, iterate over object
00147          * layers, and notify them that object is no longer busy.
00148          */
00149         list_for_each_entry_reverse(o, &top->loh_layers, lo_linkage) {
00150                 if (o->lo_ops->loo_object_release != NULL)
00151                         o->lo_ops->loo_object_release(env, o);
00152         }
00153 
00154         if (!lu_object_is_dying(top) &&
00155             (lu_object_exists(orig) || lu_object_is_cl(orig))) {
00156                 LASSERT(list_empty(&top->loh_lru));
00157                 list_add_tail(&top->loh_lru, &bkt->lsb_lru);
00158                 bkt->lsb_lru_len++;
00159                 lprocfs_counter_incr(site->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN);
00160                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Add %p to site lru. hash: %p, bkt: %p, "
00161                        "lru_len: %ld\n",
00162                        o, site->ls_obj_hash, bkt, bkt->lsb_lru_len);
00163                 cfs_hash_bd_unlock(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd, 1);
00164                 return;
00165         }
00166 
00167         /*
00168          * If object is dying (will not be cached) then remove it
00169          * from hash table and LRU.
00170          *
00171          * This is done with hash table and LRU lists locked. As the only
00172          * way to acquire first reference to previously unreferenced
00173          * object is through hash-table lookup (lu_object_find()),
00174          * or LRU scanning (lu_site_purge()), that are done under hash-table
00175          * and LRU lock, no race with concurrent object lookup is possible
00176          * and we can safely destroy object below.
00177          */
00178         if (!test_and_set_bit(LU_OBJECT_UNHASHED, &top->loh_flags))
00179                 cfs_hash_bd_del_locked(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd, &top->loh_hash);
00180         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(site->ls_obj_hash, &bd, 1);
00181         /*
00182          * Object was already removed from hash and lru above, can
00183          * kill it.
00184          */
00185         lu_object_free(env, orig);
00186 }
00187 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_put);
00188 
00193 void lu_object_put_nocache(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
00194 {
00195         set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &o->lo_header->loh_flags);
00196         return lu_object_put(env, o);
00197 }
00198 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_put_nocache);
00199 
00204 void lu_object_unhash(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
00205 {
00206         struct lu_object_header *top;
00207 
00208         top = o->lo_header;
00209         set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &top->loh_flags);
00210         if (!test_and_set_bit(LU_OBJECT_UNHASHED, &top->loh_flags)) {
00211                 struct lu_site *site = o->lo_dev->ld_site;
00212                 struct cfs_hash *obj_hash = site->ls_obj_hash;
00213                 struct cfs_hash_bd bd;
00214 
00215                 cfs_hash_bd_get_and_lock(obj_hash, &top->loh_fid, &bd, 1);
00216                 if (!list_empty(&top->loh_lru)) {
00217                         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00218 
00219                         list_del_init(&top->loh_lru);
00220                         bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(obj_hash, &bd);
00221                         bkt->lsb_lru_len--;
00222                         lprocfs_counter_decr(site->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN);
00223                 }
00224                 cfs_hash_bd_del_locked(obj_hash, &bd, &top->loh_hash);
00225                 cfs_hash_bd_unlock(obj_hash, &bd, 1);
00226         }
00227 }
00228 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_unhash);
00229 
00236 static struct lu_object *lu_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00237                                          struct lu_device *dev,
00238                                          const struct lu_fid *f,
00239                                          const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00240 {
00241         struct lu_object *scan;
00242         struct lu_object *top;
00243         struct list_head *layers;
00244         unsigned int init_mask = 0;
00245         unsigned int init_flag;
00246         int clean;
00247         int result;
00248         ENTRY;
00249 
00250         /*
00251          * Create top-level object slice. This will also create
00252          * lu_object_header.
00253          */
00254         top = dev->ld_ops->ldo_object_alloc(env, NULL, dev);
00255         if (top == NULL)
00256                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00257         if (IS_ERR(top))
00258                 RETURN(top);
00259         /*
00260          * This is the only place where object fid is assigned. It's constant
00261          * after this point.
00262          */
00263         top->lo_header->loh_fid = *f;
00264         layers = &top->lo_header->loh_layers;
00265 
00266         do {
00267                 /*
00268                  * Call ->loo_object_init() repeatedly, until no more new
00269                  * object slices are created.
00270                  */
00271                 clean = 1;
00272                 init_flag = 1;
00273                 list_for_each_entry(scan, layers, lo_linkage) {
00274                         if (init_mask & init_flag)
00275                                 goto next;
00276                         clean = 0;
00277                         scan->lo_header = top->lo_header;
00278                         result = scan->lo_ops->loo_object_init(env, scan, conf);
00279                         if (result != 0) {
00280                                 lu_object_free(env, top);
00281                                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(result));
00282                         }
00283                         init_mask |= init_flag;
00284 next:
00285                         init_flag <<= 1;
00286                 }
00287         } while (!clean);
00288 
00289         list_for_each_entry_reverse(scan, layers, lo_linkage) {
00290                 if (scan->lo_ops->loo_object_start != NULL) {
00291                         result = scan->lo_ops->loo_object_start(env, scan);
00292                         if (result != 0) {
00293                                 lu_object_free(env, top);
00294                                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(result));
00295                         }
00296                 }
00297         }
00298 
00299         lprocfs_counter_incr(dev->ld_site->ls_stats, LU_SS_CREATED);
00300         RETURN(top);
00301 }
00302 
00306 static void lu_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
00307 {
00308         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00309         struct lu_site          *site;
00310         struct lu_object        *scan;
00311         struct list_head        *layers;
00312         struct list_head         splice;
00313 
00314         site   = o->lo_dev->ld_site;
00315         layers = &o->lo_header->loh_layers;
00316         bkt    = lu_site_bkt_from_fid(site, &o->lo_header->loh_fid);
00317         /*
00318          * First call ->loo_object_delete() method to release all resources.
00319          */
00320         list_for_each_entry_reverse(scan, layers, lo_linkage) {
00321                 if (scan->lo_ops->loo_object_delete != NULL)
00322                         scan->lo_ops->loo_object_delete(env, scan);
00323         }
00324 
00325         /*
00326          * Then, splice object layers into stand-alone list, and call
00327          * ->loo_object_free() on all layers to free memory. Splice is
00328          * necessary, because lu_object_header is freed together with the
00329          * top-level slice.
00330          */
00331         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&splice);
00332         list_splice_init(layers, &splice);
00333         while (!list_empty(&splice)) {
00334                 /*
00335                  * Free layers in bottom-to-top order, so that object header
00336                  * lives as long as possible and ->loo_object_free() methods
00337                  * can look at its contents.
00338                  */
00339                 o = container_of0(splice.prev, struct lu_object, lo_linkage);
00340                 list_del_init(&o->lo_linkage);
00341                 LASSERT(o->lo_ops->loo_object_free != NULL);
00342                 o->lo_ops->loo_object_free(env, o);
00343         }
00344 
00345         if (waitqueue_active(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre))
00346                 wake_up_all(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre);
00347 }
00348 
00352 int lu_site_purge(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_site *s, int nr)
00353 {
00354         struct lu_object_header *h;
00355         struct lu_object_header *temp;
00356         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00357         struct cfs_hash_bd            bd;
00358         struct cfs_hash_bd            bd2;
00359         struct list_head         dispose;
00360         int                      did_sth;
00361         unsigned int             start = 0;
00362         int                      count;
00363         int                      bnr;
00364         unsigned int             i;
00365 
00366         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OBD_NO_LRU))
00367                 RETURN(0);
00368 
00369         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&dispose);
00370         /*
00371          * Under LRU list lock, scan LRU list and move unreferenced objects to
00372          * the dispose list, removing them from LRU and hash table.
00373          */
00374         if (nr != ~0)
00375                 start = s->ls_purge_start;
00376         bnr = (nr == ~0) ? -1 : nr / (int)CFS_HASH_NBKT(s->ls_obj_hash) + 1;
00377  again:
00378         /*
00379          * It doesn't make any sense to make purge threads parallel, that can
00380          * only bring troubles to us. See LU-5331.
00381          */
00382         mutex_lock(&s->ls_purge_mutex);
00383         did_sth = 0;
00384         cfs_hash_for_each_bucket(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd, i) {
00385                 if (i < start)
00386                         continue;
00387                 count = bnr;
00388                 cfs_hash_bd_lock(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd, 1);
00389                 bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd);
00390 
00391                 list_for_each_entry_safe(h, temp, &bkt->lsb_lru, loh_lru) {
00392                         LASSERT(atomic_read(&h->loh_ref) == 0);
00393 
00394                         cfs_hash_bd_get(s->ls_obj_hash, &h->loh_fid, &bd2);
00395                         LASSERT(bd.bd_bucket == bd2.bd_bucket);
00396 
00397                         cfs_hash_bd_del_locked(s->ls_obj_hash,
00398                                                &bd2, &h->loh_hash);
00399                         list_move(&h->loh_lru, &dispose);
00400                         bkt->lsb_lru_len--;
00401                         lprocfs_counter_decr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN);
00402                         if (did_sth == 0)
00403                                 did_sth = 1;
00404 
00405                         if (nr != ~0 && --nr == 0)
00406                                 break;
00407 
00408                         if (count > 0 && --count == 0)
00409                                 break;
00410 
00411                 }
00412                 cfs_hash_bd_unlock(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd, 1);
00413                 cond_resched();
00414                 /*
00415                  * Free everything on the dispose list. This is safe against
00416                  * races due to the reasons described in lu_object_put().
00417                  */
00418                 while (!list_empty(&dispose)) {
00419                         h = container_of0(dispose.next,
00420                                           struct lu_object_header, loh_lru);
00421                         list_del_init(&h->loh_lru);
00422                         lu_object_free(env, lu_object_top(h));
00423                         lprocfs_counter_incr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_PURGED);
00424                 }
00425 
00426                 if (nr == 0)
00427                         break;
00428         }
00429         mutex_unlock(&s->ls_purge_mutex);
00430 
00431         if (nr != 0 && did_sth && start != 0) {
00432                 start = 0; /* restart from the first bucket */
00433                 goto again;
00434         }
00435         /* race on s->ls_purge_start, but nobody cares */
00436         s->ls_purge_start = i % CFS_HASH_NBKT(s->ls_obj_hash);
00437 
00438         return nr;
00439 }
00440 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_purge);
00441 
00442 /*
00443  * Object printing.
00444  *
00445  * Code below has to jump through certain loops to output object description
00446  * into libcfs_debug_msg-based log. The problem is that lu_object_print()
00447  * composes object description from strings that are parts of _lines_ of
00448  * output (i.e., strings that are not terminated by newline). This doesn't fit
00449  * very well into libcfs_debug_msg() interface that assumes that each message
00450  * supplied to it is a self-contained output line.
00451  *
00452  * To work around this, strings are collected in a temporary buffer
00453  * (implemented as a value of lu_cdebug_key key), until terminating newline
00454  * character is detected.
00455  *
00456  */
00457 
00458 enum {
00464         LU_CDEBUG_LINE = 512
00465 };
00466 
00467 struct lu_cdebug_data {
00471         char lck_area[LU_CDEBUG_LINE];
00472 };
00473 
00474 /* context key constructor/destructor: lu_global_key_init, lu_global_key_fini */
00475 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(lu_global, struct lu_cdebug_data);
00476 
00481 static struct lu_context_key lu_global_key = {
00482         .lct_tags = LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD |
00483                     LCT_MG_THREAD | LCT_CL_THREAD | LCT_LOCAL,
00484         .lct_init = lu_global_key_init,
00485         .lct_fini = lu_global_key_fini
00486 };
00487 
00491 int lu_cdebug_printer(const struct lu_env *env,
00492                       void *cookie, const char *format, ...)
00493 {
00494         struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata = cookie;
00495         struct lu_cdebug_data        *key;
00496         int used;
00497         int complete;
00498         va_list args;
00499 
00500         va_start(args, format);
00501 
00502         key = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &lu_global_key);
00503         LASSERT(key != NULL);
00504 
00505         used = strlen(key->lck_area);
00506         complete = format[strlen(format) - 1] == '\n';
00507         /*
00508          * Append new chunk to the buffer.
00509          */
00510         vsnprintf(key->lck_area + used,
00511                   ARRAY_SIZE(key->lck_area) - used, format, args);
00512         if (complete) {
00513                 if (cfs_cdebug_show(msgdata->msg_mask, msgdata->msg_subsys))
00514                         libcfs_debug_msg(msgdata, "%s\n", key->lck_area);
00515                 key->lck_area[0] = 0;
00516         }
00517         va_end(args);
00518         return 0;
00519 }
00520 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_cdebug_printer);
00521 
00525 void lu_object_header_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00526                             lu_printer_t printer,
00527                             const struct lu_object_header *hdr)
00528 {
00529         (*printer)(env, cookie, "header@%p[%#lx, %d, "DFID"%s%s%s]",
00530                    hdr, hdr->loh_flags, atomic_read(&hdr->loh_ref),
00531                    PFID(&hdr->loh_fid),
00532                    hlist_unhashed(&hdr->loh_hash) ? "" : " hash",
00533                    list_empty((struct list_head *)&hdr->loh_lru) ? \
00534                    "" : " lru",
00535                    hdr->loh_attr & LOHA_EXISTS ? " exist" : "");
00536 }
00537 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_header_print);
00538 
00542 void lu_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00543                      lu_printer_t printer, const struct lu_object *o)
00544 {
00545         static const char ruler[] = "........................................";
00546         struct lu_object_header *top;
00547         int depth = 4;
00548 
00549         top = o->lo_header;
00550         lu_object_header_print(env, cookie, printer, top);
00551         (*printer)(env, cookie, "{\n");
00552 
00553         list_for_each_entry(o, &top->loh_layers, lo_linkage) {
00554                 /*
00555                  * print `.' \a depth times followed by type name and address
00556                  */
00557                 (*printer)(env, cookie, "%*.*s%s@%p", depth, depth, ruler,
00558                            o->lo_dev->ld_type->ldt_name, o);
00559 
00560                 if (o->lo_ops->loo_object_print != NULL)
00561                         (*o->lo_ops->loo_object_print)(env, cookie, printer, o);
00562 
00563                 (*printer)(env, cookie, "\n");
00564         }
00565 
00566         (*printer)(env, cookie, "} header@%p\n", top);
00567 }
00568 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_print);
00569 
00573 int lu_object_invariant(const struct lu_object *o)
00574 {
00575         struct lu_object_header *top;
00576 
00577         top = o->lo_header;
00578         list_for_each_entry(o, &top->loh_layers, lo_linkage) {
00579                 if (o->lo_ops->loo_object_invariant != NULL &&
00580                     !o->lo_ops->loo_object_invariant(o))
00581                         return 0;
00582         }
00583         return 1;
00584 }
00585 
00586 static struct lu_object *htable_lookup(struct lu_site *s,
00587                                        struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
00588                                        const struct lu_fid *f,
00589                                        wait_queue_t *waiter,
00590                                        __u64 *version)
00591 {
00592         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00593         struct lu_object_header *h;
00594         struct hlist_node       *hnode;
00595         __u64  ver = cfs_hash_bd_version_get(bd);
00596 
00597         if (*version == ver)
00598                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00599 
00600         *version = ver;
00601         bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(s->ls_obj_hash, bd);
00602         /* cfs_hash_bd_peek_locked is a somehow "internal" function
00603          * of cfs_hash, it doesn't add refcount on object. */
00604         hnode = cfs_hash_bd_peek_locked(s->ls_obj_hash, bd, (void *)f);
00605         if (hnode == NULL) {
00606                 lprocfs_counter_incr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_MISS);
00607                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00608         }
00609 
00610         h = container_of0(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
00611         if (likely(!lu_object_is_dying(h))) {
00612                 cfs_hash_get(s->ls_obj_hash, hnode);
00613                 lprocfs_counter_incr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_HIT);
00614                 if (!list_empty(&h->loh_lru)) {
00615                         list_del_init(&h->loh_lru);
00616                         bkt->lsb_lru_len--;
00617                         lprocfs_counter_decr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN);
00618                 }
00619                 return lu_object_top(h);
00620         }
00621 
00622         /*
00623          * Lookup found an object being destroyed this object cannot be
00624          * returned (to assure that references to dying objects are eventually
00625          * drained), and moreover, lookup has to wait until object is freed.
00626          */
00627 
00628         if (likely(waiter != NULL)) {
00629                 init_waitqueue_entry(waiter, current);
00630                 add_wait_queue(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre, waiter);
00631                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00632                 lprocfs_counter_incr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_DEATH_RACE);
00633         }
00634 
00635         return ERR_PTR(-EAGAIN);
00636 }
00637 
00643 struct lu_object *lu_object_find(const struct lu_env *env,
00644                                  struct lu_device *dev, const struct lu_fid *f,
00645                                  const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00646 {
00647         return lu_object_find_at(env, dev->ld_site->ls_top_dev, f, conf);
00648 }
00649 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_find);
00650 
00651 /*
00652  * Limit the lu_object cache to a maximum of lu_cache_nr objects.  Because
00653  * the calculation for the number of objects to reclaim is not covered by
00654  * a lock the maximum number of objects is capped by LU_CACHE_MAX_ADJUST.
00655  * This ensures that many concurrent threads will not accidentally purge
00656  * the entire cache.
00657  */
00658 static void lu_object_limit(const struct lu_env *env,
00659                             struct lu_device *dev)
00660 {
00661         __u64 size, nr;
00662 
00663         if (lu_cache_nr == LU_CACHE_NR_UNLIMITED)
00664                 return;
00665 
00666         size = cfs_hash_size_get(dev->ld_site->ls_obj_hash);
00667         nr = (__u64)lu_cache_nr;
00668         if (size > nr)
00669                 lu_site_purge(env, dev->ld_site,
00670                               MIN(size - nr, LU_CACHE_NR_MAX_ADJUST));
00671 
00672         return;
00673 }
00674 
00675 static struct lu_object *lu_object_new(const struct lu_env *env,
00676                                        struct lu_device *dev,
00677                                        const struct lu_fid *f,
00678                                        const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00679 {
00680         struct lu_object        *o;
00681         struct cfs_hash              *hs;
00682         struct cfs_hash_bd            bd;
00683 
00684         o = lu_object_alloc(env, dev, f, conf);
00685         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(o)))
00686                 return o;
00687 
00688         hs = dev->ld_site->ls_obj_hash;
00689         cfs_hash_bd_get_and_lock(hs, (void *)f, &bd, 1);
00690         cfs_hash_bd_add_locked(hs, &bd, &o->lo_header->loh_hash);
00691         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
00692 
00693         lu_object_limit(env, dev);
00694 
00695         return o;
00696 }
00697 
00701 static struct lu_object *lu_object_find_try(const struct lu_env *env,
00702                                             struct lu_device *dev,
00703                                             const struct lu_fid *f,
00704                                             const struct lu_object_conf *conf,
00705                                             wait_queue_t *waiter)
00706 {
00707         struct lu_object      *o;
00708         struct lu_object      *shadow;
00709         struct lu_site        *s;
00710         struct cfs_hash            *hs;
00711         struct cfs_hash_bd          bd;
00712         __u64                  version = 0;
00713 
00714         /*
00715          * This uses standard index maintenance protocol:
00716          *
00717          *     - search index under lock, and return object if found;
00718          *     - otherwise, unlock index, allocate new object;
00719          *     - lock index and search again;
00720          *     - if nothing is found (usual case), insert newly created
00721          *       object into index;
00722          *     - otherwise (race: other thread inserted object), free
00723          *       object just allocated.
00724          *     - unlock index;
00725          *     - return object.
00726          *
00727          * For "LOC_F_NEW" case, we are sure the object is new established.
00728          * It is unnecessary to perform lookup-alloc-lookup-insert, instead,
00729          * just alloc and insert directly.
00730          *
00731          * If dying object is found during index search, add @waiter to the
00732          * site wait-queue and return ERR_PTR(-EAGAIN).
00733          */
00734         if (conf != NULL && conf->loc_flags & LOC_F_NEW)
00735                 return lu_object_new(env, dev, f, conf);
00736 
00737         s  = dev->ld_site;
00738         hs = s->ls_obj_hash;
00739         cfs_hash_bd_get_and_lock(hs, (void *)f, &bd, 1);
00740         o = htable_lookup(s, &bd, f, waiter, &version);
00741         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
00742         if (!IS_ERR(o) || PTR_ERR(o) != -ENOENT)
00743                 return o;
00744 
00745         /*
00746          * Allocate new object. This may result in rather complicated
00747          * operations, including fld queries, inode loading, etc.
00748          */
00749         o = lu_object_alloc(env, dev, f, conf);
00750         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(o)))
00751                 return o;
00752 
00753         LASSERT(lu_fid_eq(lu_object_fid(o), f));
00754 
00755         cfs_hash_bd_lock(hs, &bd, 1);
00756 
00757         shadow = htable_lookup(s, &bd, f, waiter, &version);
00758         if (likely(IS_ERR(shadow) && PTR_ERR(shadow) == -ENOENT)) {
00759                 cfs_hash_bd_add_locked(hs, &bd, &o->lo_header->loh_hash);
00760                 cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
00761 
00762                 lu_object_limit(env, dev);
00763 
00764                 return o;
00765         }
00766 
00767         lprocfs_counter_incr(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_RACE);
00768         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
00769         lu_object_free(env, o);
00770         return shadow;
00771 }
00772 
00778 struct lu_object *lu_object_find_at(const struct lu_env *env,
00779                                     struct lu_device *dev,
00780                                     const struct lu_fid *f,
00781                                     const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00782 {
00783         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
00784         struct lu_object        *obj;
00785         wait_queue_t           wait;
00786 
00787         if (conf != NULL && conf->loc_flags & LOC_F_NOWAIT)
00788                 return lu_object_find_try(env, dev, f, conf, NULL);
00789 
00790         while (1) {
00791                 obj = lu_object_find_try(env, dev, f, conf, &wait);
00792                 if (obj != ERR_PTR(-EAGAIN))
00793                         return obj;
00794                 /*
00795                  * lu_object_find_try() already added waiter into the
00796                  * wait queue.
00797                  */
00798                 schedule();
00799                 bkt = lu_site_bkt_from_fid(dev->ld_site, (void *)f);
00800                 remove_wait_queue(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre, &wait);
00801         }
00802 }
00803 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_find_at);
00804 
00808 struct lu_object *lu_object_find_slice(const struct lu_env *env,
00809                                        struct lu_device *dev,
00810                                        const struct lu_fid *f,
00811                                        const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00812 {
00813         struct lu_object *top;
00814         struct lu_object *obj;
00815 
00816         top = lu_object_find(env, dev, f, conf);
00817         if (IS_ERR(top))
00818                 return top;
00819 
00820         obj = lu_object_locate(top->lo_header, dev->ld_type);
00821         if (unlikely(obj == NULL)) {
00822                 lu_object_put(env, top);
00823                 obj = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00824         }
00825 
00826         return obj;
00827 }
00828 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_find_slice);
00829 
00833 static struct list_head lu_device_types;
00834 
00835 int lu_device_type_init(struct lu_device_type *ldt)
00836 {
00837         int result = 0;
00838 
00839         atomic_set(&ldt->ldt_device_nr, 0);
00840         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ldt->ldt_linkage);
00841         if (ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_init)
00842                 result = ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_init(ldt);
00843 
00844         if (result == 0) {
00845                 spin_lock(&obd_types_lock);
00846                 list_add(&ldt->ldt_linkage, &lu_device_types);
00847                 spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00848         }
00849 
00850         return result;
00851 }
00852 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_type_init);
00853 
00854 void lu_device_type_fini(struct lu_device_type *ldt)
00855 {
00856         spin_lock(&obd_types_lock);
00857         list_del_init(&ldt->ldt_linkage);
00858         spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00859         if (ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_fini)
00860                 ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_fini(ldt);
00861 }
00862 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_type_fini);
