00867 static struct list_head lu_sites;
00868 static DEFINE_MUTEX(lu_sites_guard);
00869 
00873 static struct lu_env lu_shrink_env;
00874 
00875 struct lu_site_print_arg {
00876         struct lu_env   *lsp_env;
00877         void            *lsp_cookie;
00878         lu_printer_t     lsp_printer;
00879 };
00880 
00881 static int
00882 lu_site_obj_print(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
00883                   struct hlist_node *hnode, void *data)
00884 {
00885         struct lu_site_print_arg *arg = (struct lu_site_print_arg *)data;
00886         struct lu_object_header  *h;
00887 
00888         h = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
00889         if (!list_empty(&h->loh_layers)) {
00890                 const struct lu_object *o;
00891 
00892                 o = lu_object_top(h);
00893                 lu_object_print(arg->lsp_env, arg->lsp_cookie,
00894                                 arg->lsp_printer, o);
00895         } else {
00896                 lu_object_header_print(arg->lsp_env, arg->lsp_cookie,
00897                                        arg->lsp_printer, h);
00898         }
00899         return 0;
00900 }
00901 
00905 void lu_site_print(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_site *s, void *cookie,
00906                    lu_printer_t printer)
00907 {
00908         struct lu_site_print_arg arg = {
00909                 .lsp_env     = (struct lu_env *)env,
00910                 .lsp_cookie  = cookie,
00911                 .lsp_printer = printer,
00912         };
00913 
00914         cfs_hash_for_each(s->ls_obj_hash, lu_site_obj_print, &arg);
00915 }
00916 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_print);
00917 
00921 static unsigned long lu_htable_order(struct lu_device *top)
00922 {
00923         unsigned long cache_size;
00924         unsigned long bits;
00925         unsigned long bits_max = LU_SITE_BITS_MAX;
00926 
00927         /*
00928          * For ZFS based OSDs the cache should be disabled by default.  This
00929          * allows the ZFS ARC maximum flexibility in determining what buffers
00930          * to cache.  If Lustre has objects or buffer which it wants to ensure
00931          * always stay cached it must maintain a hold on them.
00932          */
00933         if (strcmp(top->ld_type->ldt_name, LUSTRE_OSD_ZFS_NAME) == 0) {
00934                 lu_cache_percent = 1;
00935                 lu_cache_nr = LU_CACHE_NR_ZFS_LIMIT;
00936                 return LU_SITE_BITS_MIN;
00937         }
00938 
00939         if (strcmp(top->ld_type->ldt_name, LUSTRE_VVP_NAME) == 0)
00940                 bits_max = LU_SITE_BITS_MAX_CL;
00941 
00942         /*
00943          * Calculate hash table size, assuming that we want reasonable
00944          * performance when 20% of total memory is occupied by cache of
00945          * lu_objects.
00946          *
00947          * Size of lu_object is (arbitrary) taken as 1K (together with inode).
00948          */
00949         cache_size = totalram_pages;
00950 
00951 #if BITS_PER_LONG == 32
00952         /* limit hashtable size for lowmem systems to low RAM */
00953         if (cache_size > 1 << (30 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT))
00954                 cache_size = 1 << (30 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) * 3 / 4;
00955 #endif
00956 
00957         /* clear off unreasonable cache setting. */
00958         if (lu_cache_percent == 0 || lu_cache_percent > LU_CACHE_PERCENT_MAX) {
00959                 CWARN("obdclass: invalid lu_cache_percent: %u, it must be in"
00960                       " the range of (0, %u]. Will use default value: %u.\n",
00961                       lu_cache_percent, LU_CACHE_PERCENT_MAX,
00962                       LU_CACHE_PERCENT_DEFAULT);
00963 
00964                 lu_cache_percent = LU_CACHE_PERCENT_DEFAULT;
00965         }
00966         cache_size = cache_size / 100 * lu_cache_percent *
00967                 (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE / 1024);
00968 
00969         for (bits = 1; (1 << bits) < cache_size; ++bits) {
00970                 ;
00971         }
00972 
00973         return clamp_t(typeof(bits), bits, LU_SITE_BITS_MIN, bits_max);
00974 }
00975 
00976 static unsigned lu_obj_hop_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs,
00977                                 const void *key, unsigned mask)
00978 {
00979         struct lu_fid  *fid = (struct lu_fid *)key;
00980         __u32           hash;
00981 
00982         hash = fid_flatten32(fid);
00983         hash += (hash >> 4) + (hash << 12); /* mixing oid and seq */
00984         hash = hash_long(hash, hs->hs_bkt_bits);
00985 
00986         /* give me another random factor */
00987         hash -= hash_long((unsigned long)hs, fid_oid(fid) % 11 + 3);
00988 
00989         hash <<= hs->hs_cur_bits - hs->hs_bkt_bits;
00990         hash |= (fid_seq(fid) + fid_oid(fid)) & (CFS_HASH_NBKT(hs) - 1);
00991 
00992         return hash & mask;
00993 }
00994 
00995 static void *lu_obj_hop_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00996 {
00997         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
00998 }
00999 
01000 static void *lu_obj_hop_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
01001 {
01002         struct lu_object_header *h;
01003 
01004         h = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
01005         return &h->loh_fid;
01006 }
01007 
01008 static int lu_obj_hop_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
01009 {
01010         struct lu_object_header *h;
01011 
01012         h = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
01013         return lu_fid_eq(&h->loh_fid, (struct lu_fid *)key);
01014 }
01015 
01016 static void lu_obj_hop_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
01017 {
01018         struct lu_object_header *h;
01019 
01020         h = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lu_object_header, loh_hash);
01021         atomic_inc(&h->loh_ref);
01022 }
01023 
01024 static void lu_obj_hop_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
01025 {
01026         LBUG(); /* we should never called it */
01027 }
01028 
01029 static struct cfs_hash_ops lu_site_hash_ops = {
01030         .hs_hash        = lu_obj_hop_hash,
01031         .hs_key         = lu_obj_hop_key,
01032         .hs_keycmp      = lu_obj_hop_keycmp,
01033         .hs_object      = lu_obj_hop_object,
01034         .hs_get         = lu_obj_hop_get,
01035         .hs_put_locked  = lu_obj_hop_put_locked,
01036 };
01037 
01038 void lu_dev_add_linkage(struct lu_site *s, struct lu_device *d)
01039 {
01040         spin_lock(&s->ls_ld_lock);
01041         if (list_empty(&d->ld_linkage))
01042                 list_add(&d->ld_linkage, &s->ls_ld_linkage);
01043         spin_unlock(&s->ls_ld_lock);
01044 }
01045 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_dev_add_linkage);
01046 
01047 void lu_dev_del_linkage(struct lu_site *s, struct lu_device *d)
01048 {
01049         spin_lock(&s->ls_ld_lock);
01050         list_del_init(&d->ld_linkage);
01051         spin_unlock(&s->ls_ld_lock);
01052 }
01053 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_dev_del_linkage);
01054 
01058 int lu_site_init(struct lu_site *s, struct lu_device *top)
01059 {
01060         struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt;
01061         struct cfs_hash_bd bd;
01062         char name[16];
01063         unsigned long bits;
01064         unsigned int i;
01065         ENTRY;
01066 
01067         memset(s, 0, sizeof *s);
01068         mutex_init(&s->ls_purge_mutex);
01069         snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "lu_site_%s", top->ld_type->ldt_name);
01070         for (bits = lu_htable_order(top);
01071              bits >= LU_SITE_BITS_MIN; bits--) {
01072                 s->ls_obj_hash = cfs_hash_create(name, bits, bits,
01073                                                  bits - LU_SITE_BKT_BITS,
01074                                                  sizeof(*bkt), 0, 0,
01075                                                  &lu_site_hash_ops,
01076                                                  CFS_HASH_SPIN_BKTLOCK |
01077                                                  CFS_HASH_NO_ITEMREF |
01078                                                  CFS_HASH_DEPTH |
01079                                                  CFS_HASH_ASSERT_EMPTY |
01080                                                  CFS_HASH_COUNTER);
01081                 if (s->ls_obj_hash != NULL)
01082                         break;
01083         }
01084 
01085         if (s->ls_obj_hash == NULL) {
01086                 CERROR("failed to create lu_site hash with bits: %lu\n", bits);
01087                 return -ENOMEM;
01088         }
01089 
01090         cfs_hash_for_each_bucket(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd, i) {
01091                 bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(s->ls_obj_hash, &bd);
01092                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&bkt->lsb_lru);
01093                 init_waitqueue_head(&bkt->lsb_marche_funebre);
01094         }
01095 
01096         s->ls_stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(LU_SS_LAST_STAT, 0);
01097         if (s->ls_stats == NULL) {
01098                 cfs_hash_putref(s->ls_obj_hash);
01099                 s->ls_obj_hash = NULL;
01100                 return -ENOMEM;
01101         }
01102 
01103         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CREATED,
01104                              0, "created", "created");
01105         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_HIT,
01106                              0, "cache_hit", "cache_hit");
01107         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_MISS,
01108                              0, "cache_miss", "cache_miss");
01109         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_RACE,
01110                              0, "cache_race", "cache_race");
01111         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_DEATH_RACE,
01112                              0, "cache_death_race", "cache_death_race");
01113         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_PURGED,
01114                              0, "lru_purged", "lru_purged");
01115         /*
01116          * Unlike other counters, lru_len can be decremented so
01117          * need lc_sum instead of just lc_count
01118          */
01119         lprocfs_counter_init(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN,
01120                              LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX, "lru_len", "lru_len");
01121 
01122         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&s->ls_linkage);
01123         s->ls_top_dev = top;
01124         top->ld_site = s;
01125         lu_device_get(top);
01126         lu_ref_add(&top->ld_reference, "site-top", s);
01127 
01128         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&s->ls_ld_linkage);
01129         spin_lock_init(&s->ls_ld_lock);
01130 
01131         lu_dev_add_linkage(s, top);
01132 
01133         RETURN(0);
01134 }
01135 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_init);
01136 
01140 void lu_site_fini(struct lu_site *s)
01141 {
01142         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
01143         list_del_init(&s->ls_linkage);
01144         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
01145 
01146         if (s->ls_obj_hash != NULL) {
01147                 cfs_hash_putref(s->ls_obj_hash);
01148                 s->ls_obj_hash = NULL;
01149         }
01150 
01151         if (s->ls_top_dev != NULL) {
01152                 s->ls_top_dev->ld_site = NULL;
01153                 lu_ref_del(&s->ls_top_dev->ld_reference, "site-top", s);
01154                 lu_device_put(s->ls_top_dev);
01155                 s->ls_top_dev = NULL;
01156         }
01157 
01158         if (s->ls_stats != NULL)
01159                 lprocfs_free_stats(&s->ls_stats);
01160 }
01161 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_fini);
01162 
01166 int lu_site_init_finish(struct lu_site *s)
01167 {
01168         int result;
01169         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
01170         result = lu_context_refill(&lu_shrink_env.le_ctx);
01171         if (result == 0)
01172                 list_add(&s->ls_linkage, &lu_sites);
01173         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
01174         return result;
01175 }
01176 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_init_finish);
01177 
01181 void lu_device_get(struct lu_device *d)
01182 {
01183         atomic_inc(&d->ld_ref);
01184 }
01185 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_get);
01186 
01190 void lu_device_put(struct lu_device *d)
01191 {
01192         LASSERT(atomic_read(&d->ld_ref) > 0);
01193         atomic_dec(&d->ld_ref);
01194 }
01195 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_put);
01196 
01200 int lu_device_init(struct lu_device *d, struct lu_device_type *t)
01201 {
01202         if (atomic_inc_return(&t->ldt_device_nr) == 1 &&
01203             t->ldt_ops->ldto_start != NULL)
01204                 t->ldt_ops->ldto_start(t);
01205 
01206         memset(d, 0, sizeof *d);
01207         d->ld_type = t;
01208         lu_ref_init(&d->ld_reference);
01209         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&d->ld_linkage);
01210 
01211         return 0;
01212 }
01213 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_init);
01214 
01218 void lu_device_fini(struct lu_device *d)
01219 {
01220         struct lu_device_type *t = d->ld_type;
01221 
01222         if (d->ld_obd != NULL) {
01223                 d->ld_obd->obd_lu_dev = NULL;
01224                 d->ld_obd = NULL;
01225         }
01226 
01227         lu_ref_fini(&d->ld_reference);
01228         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&d->ld_ref) == 0,
01229                  "Refcount is %u\n", atomic_read(&d->ld_ref));
01230         LASSERT(atomic_read(&t->ldt_device_nr) > 0);
01231 
01232         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&t->ldt_device_nr) &&
01233             t->ldt_ops->ldto_stop != NULL)
01234                 t->ldt_ops->ldto_stop(t);
01235 }
01236 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_device_fini);
01237 
01242 int lu_object_init(struct lu_object *o, struct lu_object_header *h,
01243                    struct lu_device *d)
01244 {
01245         memset(o, 0, sizeof(*o));
01246         o->lo_header = h;
01247         o->lo_dev = d;
01248         lu_device_get(d);
01249         lu_ref_add_at(&d->ld_reference, &o->lo_dev_ref, "lu_object", o);
01250         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&o->lo_linkage);
01251 
01252         return 0;
01253 }
01254 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_init);
01255 
01259 void lu_object_fini(struct lu_object *o)
01260 {
01261         struct lu_device *dev = o->lo_dev;
01262 
01263         LASSERT(list_empty(&o->lo_linkage));
01264 
01265         if (dev != NULL) {
01266                 lu_ref_del_at(&dev->ld_reference, &o->lo_dev_ref,
01267                               "lu_object", o);
01268                 lu_device_put(dev);
01269                 o->lo_dev = NULL;
01270         }
01271 }
01272 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_fini);
01273 
01280 void lu_object_add_top(struct lu_object_header *h, struct lu_object *o)
01281 {
01282         list_move(&o->lo_linkage, &h->loh_layers);
01283 }
01284 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_add_top);
01285 
01292 void lu_object_add(struct lu_object *before, struct lu_object *o)
01293 {
01294         list_move(&o->lo_linkage, &before->lo_linkage);
01295 }
01296 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_add);
01297 
01301 int lu_object_header_init(struct lu_object_header *h)
01302 {
01303         memset(h, 0, sizeof *h);
01304         atomic_set(&h->loh_ref, 1);
01305         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&h->loh_hash);
01306         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&h->loh_lru);
01307         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&h->loh_layers);
01308         lu_ref_init(&h->loh_reference);
01309         return 0;
01310 }
01311 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_header_init);
01312 
01316 void lu_object_header_fini(struct lu_object_header *h)
01317 {
01318         LASSERT(list_empty(&h->loh_layers));
01319         LASSERT(list_empty(&h->loh_lru));
01320         LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&h->loh_hash));
01321         lu_ref_fini(&h->loh_reference);
01322 }
01323 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_header_fini);
01324 
01329 struct lu_object *lu_object_locate(struct lu_object_header *h,
01330                                    const struct lu_device_type *dtype)
01331 {
01332         struct lu_object *o;
01333 
01334         list_for_each_entry(o, &h->loh_layers, lo_linkage) {
01335                 if (o->lo_dev->ld_type == dtype)
01336                         return o;
01337         }
01338         return NULL;
01339 }
01340 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_locate);
01341 
01349 void lu_stack_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *top)
01350 {
01351         struct lu_site   *site = top->ld_site;
01352         struct lu_device *scan;
01353         struct lu_device *next;
01354 
01355         lu_site_purge(env, site, ~0);
01356         for (scan = top; scan != NULL; scan = next) {
01357                 next = scan->ld_type->ldt_ops->ldto_device_fini(env, scan);
01358                 lu_ref_del(&scan->ld_reference, "lu-stack", &lu_site_init);
01359                 lu_device_put(scan);
01360         }
01361 
01362         /* purge again. */
01363         lu_site_purge(env, site, ~0);
01364 
01365         for (scan = top; scan != NULL; scan = next) {
01366                 const struct lu_device_type *ldt = scan->ld_type;
01367                 struct obd_type             *type;
01368 
01369                 next = ldt->ldt_ops->ldto_device_free(env, scan);
01370                 type = ldt->ldt_obd_type;
01371                 if (type != NULL) {
01372                         type->typ_refcnt--;
01373                         class_put_type(type);
01374                 }
01375         }
01376 }
01377 
01378 enum {
01382         LU_CONTEXT_KEY_NR = 40
01383 };
01384 
01385 static struct lu_context_key *lu_keys[LU_CONTEXT_KEY_NR] = { NULL, };
01386 
01387 DEFINE_RWLOCK(lu_keys_guard);
01388 static atomic_t lu_key_initing_cnt = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
01389 
01396 static unsigned key_set_version = 0;
01397 
01401 int lu_context_key_register(struct lu_context_key *key)
01402 {
01403         int result;
01404         unsigned int i;
01405 
01406         LASSERT(key->lct_init != NULL);
01407         LASSERT(key->lct_fini != NULL);
01408         LASSERT(key->lct_tags != 0);
01409         LASSERT(key->lct_owner != NULL);
01410 
01411         result = -ENFILE;
01412         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01413         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys); ++i) {
01414                 if (lu_keys[i] == NULL) {
01415                         key->lct_index = i;
01416                         atomic_set(&key->lct_used, 1);
01417                         lu_keys[i] = key;
01418                         lu_ref_init(&key->lct_reference);
01419                         result = 0;
01420                         ++key_set_version;
01421                         break;
01422                 }
01423         }
01424         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01425         return result;
01426 }
01427 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_register);
01428 
01429 static void key_fini(struct lu_context *ctx, int index)
01430 {
01431         if (ctx->lc_value != NULL && ctx->lc_value[index] != NULL) {
01432                 struct lu_context_key *key;
01433 
01434                 key = lu_keys[index];
01435                 LASSERT(key != NULL);
01436                 LASSERT(key->lct_fini != NULL);
01437                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&key->lct_used) > 1);
01438 
01439                 key->lct_fini(ctx, key, ctx->lc_value[index]);
01440                 lu_ref_del(&key->lct_reference, "ctx", ctx);
01441                 atomic_dec(&key->lct_used);
01442 
01443                 LASSERT(key->lct_owner != NULL);
01444                 if ((ctx->lc_tags & LCT_NOREF) == 0) {
01445                         LINVRNT(module_refcount(key->lct_owner) > 0);
01446                         module_put(key->lct_owner);
01447                 }
01448                 ctx->lc_value[index] = NULL;
01449         }
01450 }
01451 
01455 void lu_context_key_degister(struct lu_context_key *key)
01456 {
01457         LASSERT(atomic_read(&key->lct_used) >= 1);
01458         LINVRNT(0 <= key->lct_index && key->lct_index < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys));
01459 
01460         lu_context_key_quiesce(key);
01461 
01462         ++key_set_version;
01463         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01464         key_fini(&lu_shrink_env.le_ctx, key->lct_index);
01465 
01470         while (atomic_read(&key->lct_used) > 1) {
01471                 write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01472                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lu_context_key_degister: \"%s\" %p, %d\n",
01473                        key->lct_owner ? key->lct_owner->name : "", key,
01474                        atomic_read(&key->lct_used));
01475                 schedule();
01476                 write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01477         }
01478         if (lu_keys[key->lct_index]) {
01479                 lu_keys[key->lct_index] = NULL;
01480                 lu_ref_fini(&key->lct_reference);
01481         }
01482         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01483 
01484         LASSERTF(atomic_read(&key->lct_used) == 1,
01485                  "key has instances: %d\n",
01486                  atomic_read(&key->lct_used));
01487 }
01488 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_degister);
01489 
01494 int lu_context_key_register_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...)
01495 {
01496         struct lu_context_key *key = k;
01497         va_list args;
01498         int result;
01499 
01500         va_start(args, k);
01501         do {
01502                 result = lu_context_key_register(key);
01503                 if (result)
01504                         break;
01505                 key = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key *);
01506         } while (key != NULL);
01507         va_end(args);
01508 
01509         if (result != 0) {
01510                 va_start(args, k);
01511                 while (k != key) {
01512                         lu_context_key_degister(k);
01513                         k = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key *);
01514                 }
01515                 va_end(args);
01516         }
01517 
01518         return result;
01519 }
01520 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_register_many);
01521 
01526 void lu_context_key_degister_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...)
01527 {
01528         va_list args;
01529 
01530         va_start(args, k);
01531         do {
01532                 lu_context_key_degister(k);
01533                 k = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key*);
01534         } while (k != NULL);
01535         va_end(args);
01536 }
01537 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_degister_many);
01538 
01542 void lu_context_key_revive_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...)
01543 {
01544         va_list args;
01545 
01546         va_start(args, k);
01547         do {
01548                 lu_context_key_revive(k);
01549                 k = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key*);
01550         } while (k != NULL);
01551         va_end(args);
01552 }
01553 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_revive_many);
01554 
01558 void lu_context_key_quiesce_many(struct lu_context_key *k, ...)
01559 {
01560         va_list args;
01561 
01562         va_start(args, k);
01563         do {
01564                 lu_context_key_quiesce(k);
01565                 k = va_arg(args, struct lu_context_key*);
01566         } while (k != NULL);
01567         va_end(args);
01568 }
01569 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_quiesce_many);
01570 
01574 void *lu_context_key_get(const struct lu_context *ctx,
01575                          const struct lu_context_key *key)
01576 {
01577         LINVRNT(ctx->lc_state == LCS_ENTERED);
01578         LINVRNT(0 <= key->lct_index && key->lct_index < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys));
01579         LASSERT(lu_keys[key->lct_index] == key);
01580         return ctx->lc_value[key->lct_index];
01581 }
01582 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_key_get);
01583 
01587 static struct list_head lu_context_remembered;
01588 
01594 void lu_context_key_quiesce(struct lu_context_key *key)
01595 {
01596         struct lu_context *ctx;
01597         extern unsigned cl_env_cache_purge(unsigned nr);
01598 
01599         if (!(key->lct_tags & LCT_QUIESCENT)) {
01600                 /*
01601                  * XXX layering violation.
01602                  */
01603                 cl_env_cache_purge(~0);
01604                 /*
01605                  * XXX memory barrier has to go here.
01606                  */
01607                 write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01608                 key->lct_tags |= LCT_QUIESCENT;
01609 
01614                 while (atomic_read(&lu_key_initing_cnt) > 0) {
01615                         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01616                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lu_context_key_quiesce: \"%s\""
01617                                " %p, %d (%d)\n",
01618                                key->lct_owner ? key->lct_owner->name : "",
01619                                key, atomic_read(&key->lct_used),
01620                                atomic_read(&lu_key_initing_cnt));
01621                         schedule();
01622                         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01623                 }
01624 
01625                 list_for_each_entry(ctx, &lu_context_remembered,
01626                                     lc_remember)
01627                         key_fini(ctx, key->lct_index);
01628                 write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01629                 ++key_set_version;
01630         }
01631 }
01632 
01633 void lu_context_key_revive(struct lu_context_key *key)
01634 {
01635         key->lct_tags &= ~LCT_QUIESCENT;
01636         ++key_set_version;
01637 }
01638 
01639 static void keys_fini(struct lu_context *ctx)
01640 {
01641         unsigned int i;
01642 
01643         if (ctx->lc_value == NULL)
01644                 return;
01645 
01646         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys); ++i)
01647                 key_fini(ctx, i);
01648 
01649         OBD_FREE(ctx->lc_value, ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys) * sizeof ctx->lc_value[0]);
01650         ctx->lc_value = NULL;
01651 }
01652 
01653 static int keys_fill(struct lu_context *ctx)
01654 {
01655         unsigned int i;
01656 
01657         /*
01658          * A serialisation with lu_context_key_quiesce() is needed, but some
01659          * "key->lct_init()" are calling kernel memory allocation routine and
01660          * can't be called while holding a spin_lock.
01661          * "lu_keys_guard" is held while incrementing "lu_key_initing_cnt"
01662          * to ensure the start of the serialisation.
01663          * An atomic_t variable is still used, in order not to reacquire the
01664          * lock when decrementing the counter.
01665          */
01666         read_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01667         atomic_inc(&lu_key_initing_cnt);
01668         read_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01669 
01670         LINVRNT(ctx->lc_value != NULL);
01671         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys); ++i) {
01672                 struct lu_context_key *key;
01673 
01674                 key = lu_keys[i];
01675                 if (ctx->lc_value[i] == NULL && key != NULL &&
01676                     (key->lct_tags & ctx->lc_tags) &&
01677                     /*
01678                      * Don't create values for a LCT_QUIESCENT key, as this
01679                      * will pin module owning a key.
01680                      */
01681                     !(key->lct_tags & LCT_QUIESCENT)) {
01682                         void *value;
01683 
01684                         LINVRNT(key->lct_init != NULL);
01685                         LINVRNT(key->lct_index == i);
01686 
01687                         LASSERT(key->lct_owner != NULL);
01688                         if (!(ctx->lc_tags & LCT_NOREF) &&
01689                             try_module_get(key->lct_owner) == 0) {
01690                                 /* module is unloading, skip this key */
01691                                 continue;
01692                         }
01693 
01694                         value = key->lct_init(ctx, key);
01695                         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(value))) {
01696                                 atomic_dec(&lu_key_initing_cnt);
01697                                 return PTR_ERR(value);
01698                         }
01699 
01700                         lu_ref_add_atomic(&key->lct_reference, "ctx", ctx);
01701                         atomic_inc(&key->lct_used);
01702                         /*
01703                          * This is the only place in the code, where an
01704                          * element of ctx->lc_value[] array is set to non-NULL
01705                          * value.
01706                          */
01707                         ctx->lc_value[i] = value;
01708                         if (key->lct_exit != NULL)
01709                                 ctx->lc_tags |= LCT_HAS_EXIT;
01710                 }
01711                 ctx->lc_version = key_set_version;
01712         }
01713         atomic_dec(&lu_key_initing_cnt);
01714         return 0;
01715 }
01716 
01717 static int keys_init(struct lu_context *ctx)
01718 {
01719         OBD_ALLOC(ctx->lc_value, ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys) * sizeof ctx->lc_value[0]);
01720         if (likely(ctx->lc_value != NULL))
01721                 return keys_fill(ctx);
01722 
01723         return -ENOMEM;
01724 }
01725 
01729 int lu_context_init(struct lu_context *ctx, __u32 tags)
01730 {
01731         int     rc;
01732 
01733         memset(ctx, 0, sizeof *ctx);
01734         ctx->lc_state = LCS_INITIALIZED;
01735         ctx->lc_tags = tags;
01736         if (tags & LCT_REMEMBER) {
01737                 write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01738                 list_add(&ctx->lc_remember, &lu_context_remembered);
01739                 write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01740         } else {
01741                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ctx->lc_remember);
01742         }
01743 
01744         rc = keys_init(ctx);
01745         if (rc != 0)
01746                 lu_context_fini(ctx);
01747 
01748         return rc;
01749 }
01750 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_init);
01751 
01755 void lu_context_fini(struct lu_context *ctx)
01756 {
01757         LINVRNT(ctx->lc_state == LCS_INITIALIZED || ctx->lc_state == LCS_LEFT);
01758         ctx->lc_state = LCS_FINALIZED;
01759 
01760         if ((ctx->lc_tags & LCT_REMEMBER) == 0) {
01761                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ctx->lc_remember));
01762                 keys_fini(ctx);
01763 
01764         } else { /* could race with key degister */
01765                 write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01766                 keys_fini(ctx);
01767                 list_del_init(&ctx->lc_remember);
01768                 write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01769         }
01770 }
01771 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_fini);
01772 
01776 void lu_context_enter(struct lu_context *ctx)
01777 {
01778         LINVRNT(ctx->lc_state == LCS_INITIALIZED || ctx->lc_state == LCS_LEFT);
01779         ctx->lc_state = LCS_ENTERED;
01780 }
01781 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_enter);
01782 
01786 void lu_context_exit(struct lu_context *ctx)
01787 {
01788         unsigned int i;
01789 
01790         LINVRNT(ctx->lc_state == LCS_ENTERED);
01791         ctx->lc_state = LCS_LEFT;
01792         if (ctx->lc_tags & LCT_HAS_EXIT && ctx->lc_value != NULL) {
01793                 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys); ++i) {
01794                         /* could race with key quiescency */
01795                         if (ctx->lc_tags & LCT_REMEMBER)
01796                                 read_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01797                         if (ctx->lc_value[i] != NULL) {
01798                                 struct lu_context_key *key;
01799 
01800                                 key = lu_keys[i];
01801                                 LASSERT(key != NULL);
01802                                 if (key->lct_exit != NULL)
01803                                         key->lct_exit(ctx,
01804                                                       key, ctx->lc_value[i]);
01805                         }
01806                         if (ctx->lc_tags & LCT_REMEMBER)
01807                                 read_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01808                 }
01809         }
01810 }
01811 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_exit);
01812 
01818 int lu_context_refill(struct lu_context *ctx)
01819 {
01820         return likely(ctx->lc_version == key_set_version) ? 0 : keys_fill(ctx);
01821 }
01822 
01830 __u32 lu_context_tags_default = 0;
01831 __u32 lu_session_tags_default = 0;
01832 
01833 void lu_context_tags_update(__u32 tags)
01834 {
01835         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01836         lu_context_tags_default |= tags;
01837         key_set_version++;
01838         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01839 }
01840 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_tags_update);
01841 
01842 void lu_context_tags_clear(__u32 tags)
01843 {
01844         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01845         lu_context_tags_default &= ~tags;
01846         key_set_version++;
01847         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01848 }
01849 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_context_tags_clear);
01850 
01851 void lu_session_tags_update(__u32 tags)
01852 {
01853         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01854         lu_session_tags_default |= tags;
01855         key_set_version++;
01856         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01857 }
01858 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_session_tags_update);
01859 
01860 void lu_session_tags_clear(__u32 tags)
01861 {
01862         write_lock(&lu_keys_guard);
01863         lu_session_tags_default &= ~tags;
01864         key_set_version++;
01865         write_unlock(&lu_keys_guard);
01866 }
01867 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_session_tags_clear);
01868 
01869 int lu_env_init(struct lu_env *env, __u32 tags)
01870 {
01871         int result;
01872 
01873         env->le_ses = NULL;
01874         result = lu_context_init(&env->le_ctx, tags);
01875         if (likely(result == 0))
01876                 lu_context_enter(&env->le_ctx);
01877         return result;
01878 }
01879 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_env_init);
01880 
01881 void lu_env_fini(struct lu_env *env)
01882 {
01883         lu_context_exit(&env->le_ctx);
01884         lu_context_fini(&env->le_ctx);
01885         env->le_ses = NULL;
01886 }
01887 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_env_fini);
01888 
01889 int lu_env_refill(struct lu_env *env)
01890 {
01891         int result;
01892 
01893         result = lu_context_refill(&env->le_ctx);
01894         if (result == 0 && env->le_ses != NULL)
01895                 result = lu_context_refill(env->le_ses);
01896         return result;
01897 }
01898 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_env_refill);
01899 
01907 int lu_env_refill_by_tags(struct lu_env *env, __u32 ctags,
01908                           __u32 stags)
01909 {
01910         int    result;
01911 
01912         if ((env->le_ctx.lc_tags & ctags) != ctags) {
01913                 env->le_ctx.lc_version = 0;
01914                 env->le_ctx.lc_tags |= ctags;
01915         }
01916 
01917         if (env->le_ses && (env->le_ses->lc_tags & stags) != stags) {
01918                 env->le_ses->lc_version = 0;
01919                 env->le_ses->lc_tags |= stags;
01920         }
01921 
01922         result = lu_env_refill(env);
01923 
01924         return result;
01925 }
01926 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_env_refill_by_tags);
01927 
01928 static struct shrinker *lu_site_shrinker;
01929 
01930 typedef struct lu_site_stats{
01931         unsigned        lss_populated;
01932         unsigned        lss_max_search;
01933         unsigned        lss_total;
01934         unsigned        lss_busy;
01935 } lu_site_stats_t;
01936 
01937 static void lu_site_stats_get(struct cfs_hash *hs,
01938                               lu_site_stats_t *stats, int populated)
01939 {
01940         struct cfs_hash_bd bd;
01941         unsigned int  i;
01942 
01943         cfs_hash_for_each_bucket(hs, &bd, i) {
01944                 struct lu_site_bkt_data *bkt = cfs_hash_bd_extra_get(hs, &bd);
01945                 struct hlist_head       *hhead;
01946 
01947                 cfs_hash_bd_lock(hs, &bd, 1);
01948                 stats->lss_busy  +=
01949                         cfs_hash_bd_count_get(&bd) - bkt->lsb_lru_len;
01950                 stats->lss_total += cfs_hash_bd_count_get(&bd);
01951                 stats->lss_max_search = max((int)stats->lss_max_search,
01952                                             cfs_hash_bd_depmax_get(&bd));
01953                 if (!populated) {
01954                         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
01955                         continue;
01956                 }
01957 
01958                 cfs_hash_bd_for_each_hlist(hs, &bd, hhead) {
01959                         if (!hlist_empty(hhead))
01960                                 stats->lss_populated++;
01961                 }
01962                 cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
01963         }
01964 }
01965 
01966 
01967 /*
01968  * lu_cache_shrink_count returns the number of cached objects that are
01969  * candidates to be freed by shrink_slab(). A counter, which tracks
01970  * the number of items in the site's lru, is maintained in the per cpu
01971  * stats of each site. The counter is incremented when an object is added
01972  * to a site's lru and decremented when one is removed. The number of
01973  * free-able objects is the sum of all per cpu counters for all sites.
01974  *
01975  * Using a per cpu counter is a compromise solution to concurrent access:
01976  * lu_object_put() can update the counter without locking the site and
01977  * lu_cache_shrink_count can sum the counters without locking each
01978  * ls_obj_hash bucket.
01979  */
01980 static unsigned long lu_cache_shrink_count(struct shrinker *sk,
01981                                            struct shrink_control *sc)
01982 {
01983         struct lu_site *s;
01984         struct lu_site *tmp;
01985         unsigned long cached = 0;
01986 
01987         if (!(sc->gfp_mask & __GFP_FS))
01988                 return 0;
01989 
01990         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
01991         list_for_each_entry_safe(s, tmp, &lu_sites, ls_linkage) {
01992                 cached += ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN);
01993         }
01994         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
01995 
01996         cached = (cached / 100) * sysctl_vfs_cache_pressure;
01997         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "%ld objects cached, cache pressure %d\n",
01998                cached, sysctl_vfs_cache_pressure);
01999 
02000         return cached;
02001 }
02002 
02003 static unsigned long lu_cache_shrink_scan(struct shrinker *sk,
02004                                           struct shrink_control *sc)
02005 {
02006         struct lu_site *s;
02007         struct lu_site *tmp;
02008         unsigned long remain = sc->nr_to_scan;
02009         LIST_HEAD(splice);
02010 
02011         if (!(sc->gfp_mask & __GFP_FS))
02012                 /* We must not take the lu_sites_guard lock when
02013                  * __GFP_FS is *not* set because of the deadlock
02014                  * possibility detailed above. Additionally,
02015                  * since we cannot determine the number of
02016                  * objects in the cache without taking this
02017                  * lock, we're in a particularly tough spot. As
02018                  * a result, we'll just lie and say our cache is
02019                  * empty. This _should_ be ok, as we can't
02020                  * reclaim objects when __GFP_FS is *not* set
02021                  * anyways.
02022                  */
02023                 return SHRINK_STOP;
02024 
02025         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
02026         list_for_each_entry_safe(s, tmp, &lu_sites, ls_linkage) {
02027                 remain = lu_site_purge(&lu_shrink_env, s, remain);
02028                 /*
02029                  * Move just shrunk site to the tail of site list to
02030                  * assure shrinking fairness.
02031                  */
02032                 list_move_tail(&s->ls_linkage, &splice);
02033         }
02034         list_splice(&splice, lu_sites.prev);
02035         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
02036 
02037         return sc->nr_to_scan - remain;
02038 }
02039 
02040 #ifndef HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT
02041 /*
02042  * There exists a potential lock inversion deadlock scenario when using
02043  * Lustre on top of ZFS. This occurs between one of ZFS's
02044  * buf_hash_table.ht_lock's, and Lustre's lu_sites_guard lock. Essentially,
02045  * thread A will take the lu_sites_guard lock and sleep on the ht_lock,
02046  * while thread B will take the ht_lock and sleep on the lu_sites_guard
02047  * lock. Obviously neither thread will wake and drop their respective hold
02048  * on their lock.
02049  *
02050  * To prevent this from happening we must ensure the lu_sites_guard lock is
02051  * not taken while down this code path. ZFS reliably does not set the
02052  * __GFP_FS bit in its code paths, so this can be used to determine if it
02053  * is safe to take the lu_sites_guard lock.
02054  *
02055  * Ideally we should accurately return the remaining number of cached
02056  * objects without taking the lu_sites_guard lock, but this is not
02057  * possible in the current implementation.
02058  */
02059 static int lu_cache_shrink(SHRINKER_ARGS(sc, nr_to_scan, gfp_mask))
02060 {
02061         int cached = 0;
02062         struct shrink_control scv = {
02063                  .nr_to_scan = shrink_param(sc, nr_to_scan),
02064                  .gfp_mask   = shrink_param(sc, gfp_mask)
02065         };
02066 #if !defined(HAVE_SHRINKER_WANT_SHRINK_PTR) && !defined(HAVE_SHRINK_CONTROL)
02067         struct shrinker* shrinker = NULL;
02068 #endif
02069 
02070 
02071         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Shrink %lu objects\n", scv.nr_to_scan);
02072 
02073         if (scv.nr_to_scan != 0)
02074                 lu_cache_shrink_scan(shrinker, &scv);
02075 
02076         cached = lu_cache_shrink_count(shrinker, &scv);
02077         return cached;
02078 }
02079 
02080 #endif /* HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT */
02081 
02082 
02083 /*
02084  * Debugging stuff.
02085  */
02086 
02090 static struct lu_env lu_debugging_env;
02091 
02095 int lu_printk_printer(const struct lu_env *env,
02096                       void *unused, const char *format, ...)
02097 {
02098         va_list args;
02099 
02100         va_start(args, format);
02101         vprintk(format, args);
02102         va_end(args);
02103         return 0;
02104 }
02105 
02106 int lu_debugging_setup(void)
02107 {
02108         return lu_env_init(&lu_debugging_env, ~0);
02109 }
02110 
02111 void lu_context_keys_dump(void)
02112 {
02113         unsigned int i;
02114 
02115         for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(lu_keys); ++i) {
02116                 struct lu_context_key *key;
02117 
02118                 key = lu_keys[i];
02119                 if (key != NULL) {
02120                         CERROR("[%d]: %p %x (%p,%p,%p) %d %d \"%s\"@%p\n",
02121                                i, key, key->lct_tags,
02122                                key->lct_init, key->lct_fini, key->lct_exit,
02123                                key->lct_index, atomic_read(&key->lct_used),
02124                                key->lct_owner ? key->lct_owner->name : "",
02125                                key->lct_owner);
02126                         lu_ref_print(&key->lct_reference);
02127                 }
02128         }
02129 }
02130 
02134 int lu_global_init(void)
02135 {
02136         int result;
02137         DEF_SHRINKER_VAR(shvar, lu_cache_shrink,
02138                          lu_cache_shrink_count, lu_cache_shrink_scan);
02139 
02140         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Lustre LU module (%p).\n", &lu_keys);
02141 
02142         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lu_device_types);
02143         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lu_context_remembered);
02144         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lu_sites);
02145 
02146         result = lu_ref_global_init();
02147         if (result != 0)
02148                 return result;
02149 
02150         LU_CONTEXT_KEY_INIT(&lu_global_key);
02151         result = lu_context_key_register(&lu_global_key);
02152         if (result != 0)
02153                 return result;
02154 
02155         /*
02156          * At this level, we don't know what tags are needed, so allocate them
02157          * conservatively. This should not be too bad, because this
02158          * environment is global.
02159          */
02160         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
02161         result = lu_env_init(&lu_shrink_env, LCT_SHRINKER);
02162         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
02163         if (result != 0)
02164                 return result;
02165 
02166         /*
02167          * seeks estimation: 3 seeks to read a record from oi, one to read
02168          * inode, one for ea. Unfortunately setting this high value results in
02169          * lu_object/inode cache consuming all the memory.
02170          */
02171         lu_site_shrinker = set_shrinker(DEFAULT_SEEKS, &shvar);
02172         if (lu_site_shrinker == NULL)
02173                 return -ENOMEM;
02174 
02175         return result;
02176 }
02177 
02181 void lu_global_fini(void)
02182 {
02183         if (lu_site_shrinker != NULL) {
02184                 remove_shrinker(lu_site_shrinker);
02185                 lu_site_shrinker = NULL;
02186         }
02187 
02188         lu_context_key_degister(&lu_global_key);
02189 
02190         /*
02191          * Tear shrinker environment down _after_ de-registering
02192          * lu_global_key, because the latter has a value in the former.
02193          */
02194         mutex_lock(&lu_sites_guard);
02195         lu_env_fini(&lu_shrink_env);
02196         mutex_unlock(&lu_sites_guard);
02197 
02198         lu_ref_global_fini();
02199 }
02200 
02201 static __u32 ls_stats_read(struct lprocfs_stats *stats, int idx)
02202 {
02203 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
02204         struct lprocfs_counter ret;
02205 
02206         lprocfs_stats_collect(stats, idx, &ret);
02207         if (idx == LU_SS_LRU_LEN)
02208                 /*
02209                  * protect against counter on cpu A being decremented
02210                  * before counter is incremented on cpu B; unlikely
02211                  */
02212                 return (__u32)((ret.lc_sum > 0) ? ret.lc_sum : 0);
02213         else
02214                 return (__u32)ret.lc_count;
02215 #else
02216         return 0;
02217 #endif
02218 }
02219 
02224 int lu_site_stats_seq_print(const struct lu_site *s, struct seq_file *m)
02225 {
02226         lu_site_stats_t stats;
02227 
02228         memset(&stats, 0, sizeof(stats));
02229         lu_site_stats_get(s->ls_obj_hash, &stats, 1);
02230 
02231         seq_printf(m, "%d/%d %d/%d %d %d %d %d %d %d %d %d\n",
02232                    stats.lss_busy,
02233                    stats.lss_total,
02234                    stats.lss_populated,
02235                    CFS_HASH_NHLIST(s->ls_obj_hash),
02236                    stats.lss_max_search,
02237                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CREATED),
02238                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_HIT),
02239                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_MISS),
02240                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_RACE),
02241                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_CACHE_DEATH_RACE),
02242                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_PURGED),
02243                    ls_stats_read(s->ls_stats, LU_SS_LRU_LEN));
02244         return 0;
02245 }
02246 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_site_stats_seq_print);
02247 
02251 int lu_kmem_init(struct lu_kmem_descr *caches)
02252 {
02253         int result;
02254         struct lu_kmem_descr *iter = caches;
02255 
02256         for (result = 0; iter->ckd_cache != NULL; ++iter) {
02257                 *iter->ckd_cache = kmem_cache_create(iter->ckd_name,
02258                                                      iter->ckd_size,
02259                                                      0, 0, NULL);
02260                 if (*iter->ckd_cache == NULL) {
02261                         result = -ENOMEM;
02262                         /* free all previously allocated caches */
02263                         lu_kmem_fini(caches);
02264                         break;
02265                 }
02266         }
02267         return result;
02268 }
02269 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_kmem_init);
02270 
02275 void lu_kmem_fini(struct lu_kmem_descr *caches)
02276 {
02277         for (; caches->ckd_cache != NULL; ++caches) {
02278                 if (*caches->ckd_cache != NULL) {
02279                         kmem_cache_destroy(*caches->ckd_cache);
02280                         *caches->ckd_cache = NULL;
02281                 }
02282         }
02283 }
02284 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_kmem_fini);
02285 
02290 void lu_object_assign_fid(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o,
02291                           const struct lu_fid *fid)
02292 {
02293         struct lu_site          *s = o->lo_dev->ld_site;
02294         struct lu_fid           *old = &o->lo_header->loh_fid;
02295         struct lu_object        *shadow;
02296         wait_queue_t             waiter;
02297         struct cfs_hash         *hs;
02298         struct cfs_hash_bd       bd;
02299         __u64                    version = 0;
02300 
02301         LASSERT(fid_is_zero(old));
02302 
02303         hs = s->ls_obj_hash;
02304         cfs_hash_bd_get_and_lock(hs, (void *)fid, &bd, 1);
02305         shadow = htable_lookup(s, &bd, fid, &waiter, &version);
02306         /* supposed to be unique */
02307         LASSERT(IS_ERR(shadow) && PTR_ERR(shadow) == -ENOENT);
02308         *old = *fid;
02309         cfs_hash_bd_add_locked(hs, &bd, &o->lo_header->loh_hash);
02310         cfs_hash_bd_unlock(hs, &bd, 1);
02311 }
02312 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_assign_fid);
02313 
02319 struct lu_object *lu_object_anon(const struct lu_env *env,
02320                                  struct lu_device *dev,
02321                                  const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
02322 {
02323         struct lu_fid     fid;
02324         struct lu_object *o;
02325 
02326         fid_zero(&fid);
02327         o = lu_object_alloc(env, dev, &fid, conf);
02328 
02329         return o;
02330 }
02331 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_object_anon);
02332 
02333 struct lu_buf LU_BUF_NULL = {
02334         .lb_buf = NULL,
02335         .lb_len = 0
02336 };
02337 EXPORT_SYMBOL(LU_BUF_NULL);
02338 
02339 void lu_buf_free(struct lu_buf *buf)
02340 {
02341         LASSERT(buf);
02342         if (buf->lb_buf) {
02343                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len > 0);
02344                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
02345                 buf->lb_buf = NULL;
02346                 buf->lb_len = 0;
02347         }
02348 }
02349 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_buf_free);
02350 
02351 void lu_buf_alloc(struct lu_buf *buf, size_t size)
02352 {
02353         LASSERT(buf);
02354         LASSERT(buf->lb_buf == NULL);
02355         LASSERT(buf->lb_len == 0);
02356         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(buf->lb_buf, size);
02357         if (likely(buf->lb_buf))
02358                 buf->lb_len = size;
02359 }
02360 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_buf_alloc);
02361 
02362 void lu_buf_realloc(struct lu_buf *buf, size_t size)
02363 {
02364         lu_buf_free(buf);
02365         lu_buf_alloc(buf, size);
02366 }
02367 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_buf_realloc);
02368 
02369 struct lu_buf *lu_buf_check_and_alloc(struct lu_buf *buf, size_t len)
02370 {
02371         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL && buf->lb_len == 0)
02372                 lu_buf_alloc(buf, len);
02373 
02374         if ((len > buf->lb_len) && (buf->lb_buf != NULL))
02375                 lu_buf_realloc(buf, len);
02376 
02377         return buf;
02378 }
02379 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lu_buf_check_and_alloc);
02380 
02387 int lu_buf_check_and_grow(struct lu_buf *buf, size_t len)
02388 {
02389         char *ptr;
02390 
02391         if (len <= buf->lb_len)
02392                 return 0;
02393 
02394         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(ptr, len);
02395         if (ptr == NULL)
02396                 return -ENOMEM;
02397 
02398         /* Free the old buf */
02399         if (buf->lb_buf != NULL) {
02400                 memcpy(ptr, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
02401                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
02402         }
02403 
02404         buf->lb_buf = ptr;
02405         buf->lb_len = len;
02406         return 0;
02407 }
